page.title: 11DUMFRIES IN THE 1920's(cont)
page.content: {ENTERTAINMENT In 1920 they celebrated Burns' day much the same as now, with dances and suppers etc. {WORK Most people worked in factories such as the thread mills. Mrs McConville made stockings. The clothes that the women wore were, long skirts and floppy hats with big hat pins. There was a lot of poor people so some people set up a stall where the poor could go to get some free soup. {THEN AND NOW Mrs McConville said she preferred Dumfries in the 1920's with horses and carts more than today's cars and lorries because it is far too busy now.
